etymology.description: 流(flow; spread) + 行(go; practice) = circulate widely; be in vogue
etymology.interpretation: Evokes something moving like a current through people or places, hence widely prevalent or fashionable. Applies to trends and also to the spread of diseases.

parts.english: to flow; to spread; stream/current; to shed (tears)
to go; to travel; to act; conduct/behavior

examples.chinese: 这首歌很流行(這首歌很流行)。
今年流行穿浅色的衣服(今年流行穿淺色的衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Jīnnián liúxíng chuān qiǎnsè de yīfu.
examples.english: This year it’s fashionable to wear light-colored clothes.

examples.chinese: 这种病毒在冬天容易流行(這種病毒在冬天容易流行)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng bìngdú zài dōngtiān róngyì liúxíng.
examples.english: This kind of virus tends to become prevalent in winter.
